p: Zingiber nimmonii (J. Graham) Dalzell is an endemic species from the Western Ghats in South India. The major components of the rhizome EO were different from the rhizome EO obtained from other species. The major constituents were myrcene (5.1%), β-caryophyllene (26.9%), α-humulene (19.6%) and α-cadinol (5.2%) [ 61]. These results are also in accordance with Sabulal et al. [ 19] who showed that Z. nimmonii EO is a unique caryophyllene-rich natural source.
